messages.subject: Buffy fandom
messages.msgSnippet: **As for Buffy: What d you think of the season ender?  That last thirty seconds made me fall off my chair!** Hi, Bridget -- I had read Buffy spoiler boards on
messages.messageBody:
**As for Buffy:

What'd you think of the season ender? That last thirty seconds made
me fall off my chair!**

Hi, Bridget --

I had read Buffy spoiler boards on the Television Without Pity website
every day for about six weeks leading up to the finale. (That's
obsession!) So I knew what was going to happen. Which made for a
completely different viewing experience.

Feel free to email me offlist if you want to chat more, but be warned, I
know too much!

I've seen recaps of a pretty interesting interview with one of the Buffy
scriptwriters (Jane Espenson) who says the Spike's quest scenes were
intentionally misleading. Their objective was to make people fall off
of their chairs.

I've read a lot of speculation about what Spike's personality (and hair)
are going to be like next season. Be warned, I can go for hours on the
whole Buffy and Spike topic, which has only a very tenuous connection to
unschooling. So I'll stop here. For. Now.

Betsy
